title: Zeek - Network Protocols
description: - This dashboard gives insights into network protocols such as FTP, HTTP, RDP, SMTP, SMTP Links, Socks, SSH, Tunnel, SMB Files, and SMB Mapping.

definition.content:
## Overview
- This dashboard gives insights into network protocols such as FTP, HTTP, RDP, SMTP, SMTP Links, Socks, SSH, Tunnel, SMB Files, and SMB Mapping.

## Widgets
1. Avg. File Size Being Transferred
2. Top 10 Commands
3. Files by Mime Type
4. FTP Session by Users
5. Top Reply Codes from Server
6. FTP Log Details
7. Total Uncompressed Content Size of the Data Transferred from the Client
8. HTTP Requests by Methods
9. Total Uncompressed Content Size of the Data Transferred from the Server
10. Top 10 Originators
11. Top 10 Hosts
12. Top 10 Status Codes
13. Top 10 Requested URIs
14. Host Breakdown By HTTP Method
15. Host Breakdown By HTTP Status Code
16. HTTP Log Details
17. Security Protocols
18. Top 10 Requested Channels by Client
19. Top 10 Client Machine Name
20. Top 10 Encryption Methods
21. RDP Log Details
22. Top 10 Email by Sender
23. Top 10 Email by Recipient
24. Top 10 Clients
25. SMTP Log Details
26. Top 10 Domain
27. SMTP Links Log Details
28. SOCKS Protocol Versions
29. Top 10 Login Requested Users
30. Requests by Address and Port
31. Server Bound Addresses with Port
32. Password Capture Count
33. Server Status Over Time
34. SOCKS Log Details
35. No. of Auth Attempts
36. Successful Authentications
37. Failed Authentications
38. Failed SSH Authentication Rate
39. SSH Versions
40. Authentication Directions
41. Top 10 Signing (MAC) Algorithm Used
42. Top 10 Compression Algorithm Used
43. Top 10 Encryption Algorithm Used
44. Top 10 Server Key Algorithm
45. Top 10 Key Exchange Algorithm Used
46. SSH Log Details
47. Top 10 Tunnel Types
48. Discovered Tunnel Connection Over Time
49. Tunnel Activities
50. Tunnel Log Details
51. Avg. Size of File
52. Top 10 SMB Actions
53. Top 10 Clients
54. SMB Files Log Details
55. Top 10 Resource Types
56. Top 10 Clients
57. SMB Mapping Log Details

definition.title: Total Uncompressed Content Size of the Data Transferred from the Client
Total Uncompressed Content Size of the Data Transferred from the Server
Host Breakdown By HTTP Status Code
